comments.body: There seems no claver way then this to set newlines in variables in batch files.
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -20,7 +20,13 @@ rem
 rem Figure out where the Spark framework is installed
 call "%~dp0find-spark-home.cmd"
 
-set _SPARK_CMD_USAGE=Usage: .\bin\spark-shell.cmd [options]
+set LF=^
+
+
+rem two empty lines are required
+set _SPARK_CMD_USAGE=Usage: .\bin\spark-shell.cmd [options]^%LF%%LF%^%LF%%LF%^
+Scala REPL options:^%LF%%LF%^

comments.body: Script specific information looks included in `_SPARK_CMD_USAGE` - looks it's appropriate place then somewhere in `SparkSubmitArguments.printUsageAndExit`.
